column5: JoeyT and I escaped for the day, starting at 530am and ending at 530pm. I haven't been out much this year due to work and family fun, so I was especially looking forward to this.  Gotta love living in the country; I was able to sled right from my doorstep to the lake.  The morning bite was crazy until 10am, it then slowed down for the rest of the day, so we made a few fires and drilled a few holes looking for big ones.  No big ones found but we got our limits of 5 each! I don't think I've ever done that lake spec fishing before.    Spec fingers! kind of like jazz hands.
I'd say that you had a good day.
Nice! I wish we had conditions like that around here. I'm gonna have to cut my grass soon down here.  S.
nice! nothing better to a day on the sleds rewarded with some brookies
Great pics, what a great way to spend the day, looks beautiful where u are
I had a blast, and supper will be fantastic I bet.  I refuse to let the ice melt until I can ice my giant speckasaurus
Speck Finger - sounds like a new Bond villain.  What a great day guys!
Well done fellas. The 4th pic is so relaxing. Did ya bring some marshmellos?
No marshmallows, but canned tuna and egg salad sammies yes!
Awesome!!  Looks like a mint trip.
Now thats what I call ice fishing...thanks for the pics
Looks like team Polaris had a great day. Sweet report guys!  How much ice up there?
Backlakes have a foot of ice, but over half of it is white crap.  Too much snow and not enough cold.
Nice! Looks like a great day was had. Awesome report.
Great way to spend a day.  Envy here dood.  Nice speckins!
